intro: Gelonium borneense, commonly known as the Bornean gelonium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, white or yellowish flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant, thriving in the humid and shaded conditions of the forest floor. Its botanical features make it an important component of the biodiversity in its native habitat.
